cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I’ve found another terminal. The files have been partially deleted, but... this facility was run by Section 31!
Who the devil are they?
Section 31 is a clandestine group within Starfleet. They’re prepared to do anything to protect the Federation.
This base was testing a new form of tactical computer.
They discovered an experimental processor, capable of granting the device a more... human… response.
Hrm. That sounds suspiciously like an "emotion chip". It can have... unpredicatable results.
They were trying to use it to predict the behavior of biological life forms, creating a machine that knows how we think...
... then using that against us.
But what about the researchers that were here? Where are they now?

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Thank you for opening the doors. We lay claim to this base for the Cardassian Union!
Stop firing at us, you idiots! We're flesh and blood, same as you!
I suggest conversing them AFTER we incapacitate them, Doctor.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I’ve found another personnel log. Stand by...
Chief scientist’s personal log. Thanks to the new processor, we’re making extraordinary progress!
We’ve programmed Talos to create more realistic and unpredictable holograms.
But there have been concerns that the sheer amount of energy required has begun to destabilize some of the secondary systems.
There is no cause for alarm, chief scientist.
Such disruptions are well within the range of acceptable stress parameters. Our work together will proceed as planned.
... Thank you, Talos. End log.
Sounds like this “Talos” has a mind of its own...

encounter.locDescription: Hostile holograms detected. Prepare for combat.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: If this is a Starfleet program, it will be programmed to obey our orders.
Computer, this is Lieutenant Worf of the U.S.S. Enterprise. Cease all aggressive activity at once!
Command not accepted.  Primary protocol is protecting the central Core. Talos must survive.

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I'm picking up life signs around the base. Energy readings show traces of an attack. Could be the Cardassians.
Any sign of Starfleet crew out there?
Not yet. Atmospheric ionization could be blocking a precise reading from our tricorders.
We should prepare for battle. The Cardassians will NOT show mercy.
I’ve located supplies. It seems they were left behind by the Cardassians.
Why, that’s Protomatter! We can use that to upgrade or unlock new Skills.

Are all you Cardassians this paranoid? Stand down and we’ll get you medical assistance.
We won’t fall for any more of your Federation tricks. Fire at will!

As you wish. Soldiers, weapons ready!

Commander Burnham of the U.S.S. Discovery hailing Federation outpost, please respond! I repeat, this is Commander Burnham...
We must assume the worst. The Cardassians may have penetrated the facility’s defenses.
Let’s regroup on the Artemis and plan our next move.

Damned thing is going haywire. Looks like we’ll have to find our own way in.
I suggest we cut through the door. It is the most direct approach.
Or I can override the door’s security protocols. A more cautious approach might be better…

They are hardly friendly, Doctor!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I’m accessing the complex’s database. This is a research facility working on something named “Project Talos”.
That would explain the “ghosts”. These scientists must have been inspired by Talosian illusions. I’ve had first-hand experience with them. All too real.
As in Talos IV? But travel to that planet’s forbidden by Starfleet.
Blame Spock.
You know that aggravating Vulcan too?
It’s a long story.
Chief scientist’s personal log. We’ve made a breakthrough with Project Talos.
Exposing the central logic circuits to various threat scenarios has increased its combat effectiveness by 72.3%.
Talos, how are we doing today?
All systems are operating within 99.2% of normal parameters.
My staff has expressed ethical concerns about subjecting such an advanced artificial intelligence to repeated traumatic combat scenarios.
I have to remind them that it’s still a computer, not a human being, even considering our recent modifications. End recording.
I have located a storage chest, but I am having difficulty opening it...  This mechanism is most aggravating.
Don’t look at me. I’m a doctor, not a locksmith.
Let me take a look. I have a knack for this kind of thing…

This base was testing a new form of tactical computer.
They discovered an experimental processor, capable of granting the device a more... human… response.

They were trying to use it to predict the behavior of biological life forms, creating a machine that knows how we think...
... then using that against us.
But what about the researchers that were here? Where are they now?

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: I’ve found another personal log...
Emergency log. Talos is no longer following our commands.
A mysterious power surge in the core has Talos is stuck in a feedback loop.
It thinks our threat response scenarios are real. It’s trying to purge the base using the EDH programs!
I’ve sent out a distress signal, but I don’t know how much longer we can--
--Transmission terminated--
This blasted machine killed everyone! It can’t distinguish between a simulation and reality!
Operation parameters uncertain. Extreme measures taken to protect central core. Talos must survive.

I think it's trying to find someone strong enough to defeat us...
Result: William T. Riker, First Officer of the U.S.S. Enterprise.
Riker is a trusted friend. But we must remember that these are only holograms!

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: This machine is responsible for the death of everyone involved in its creation. It’s too dangerous. We’ve got to destroy it!
Perhaps…
But on MY Enterprise, Commander Data was an android with an intelligence matching that of Talos, and I was honored to call him my friend.
Talos seeks to preserve itself. Is that not a sign of sentience?
First a Klingon officer, now a robot? What’s gotten into Starfleet in the future?
This energy seems to be corrupting the system. If we purge it, we can restart Talos and give him a second chance.

exploration.locReactionDialogueId: I’ve purged the excess energy from the system and triggered a restart of Talos’s core systems.
exploration.locResultDescLoc: Talos has been revived. Will it still be murderous, or benign?

cutSceneDialogue.locDialogueBody: Computer, what is the status of Project Talos?
There are no records of Project Talos in the Starfleet database.
Finally, a machine that will listen to us! It’s about time.
The system is coming back online. Here goes nothing...
System online. Identifying Starfleet personnel. Welcome to Talos Base, Doctor McCoy.
At least it’s learned some manners.
We’ll disable the distress call. You’ll be left alone for a long time, Talos.
System diagnostic in progress. Searching for new directives... Thank you for your assistance.
I’m reading a powerful energy source inside the machine…
Let me see... Ah! There’s some sort of device inside the housing!
Perhaps this is the experimental processor they mentioned?
I don’t know. I’ve never seen anything like it before.
Intriguing. The energy pouring out of it appears similar to the ribbon in space that trapped us here in the Nexus.
You’re right, man. Let's bring it back to the ship. With any luck it might tell us more about this damn dimension!

missions.locDescription: The computer core of Talos must be disabled at all costs, to prevent further loss of life.
